page.title: 01Sywell - an introduction
page.content: Sywell is a small village, N.E. of Northampton. It is divided into two parts - the old and the new. The houses in the old village are more than 150 years old. They were built around the church. Next to the church is the original school. The old buildings are built of local Northamptonshire sand and ironstone. There used to be a post office and a pub. The new village has been built since the 1930's. There are mostly bungalows along the main road with very large gardens. There are some large and grand houses, some with swimming pools. The only shop is in the new part and opposite this is the primary school. There is one pub (The Horseshoe) with a garden. There is an airport for light planes and some light industry. There is a motel with a restaurant and bars. Most of the land around Sywell is farmland.
